Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Splatter \Splat"ter\, v. i. & t. To spatter; to splash. [1913 Webster]

splatter n 1: the noise of something spattering or sputtering explosively; "he heard a spatter of gunfire" [syn: {spatter}, {spattering}, {splattering}, {sputter}, {splutter}, {sputtering}] 2: a small quantity of something moist or soft; "a dab of paint"; "a splatter of mud" [syn: {dab}, {splash}] v 1: cause or allow (a liquid substance) to run or flow from a container; "spill the milk"; "splatter water" [syn: {spill}, {slop}] 2: dash a liquid upon or against; "The mother splashed the baby's face with water" [syn: {spatter}, {plash}, {splash}, {splosh}, {swash}]
